info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 27 at 1:17PM EDT until July 27 at 10:15PM EDT by NWS Northern Indiana
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northern Indiana, including the following county, Jay.
* WHEN...Until 1015 PM EDT Sunday.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Emergency management has reported extensive street flooding in Portland.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 115 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Runoff from heavy rainfall today and from heavy rainfall that occurred yesterday will continue to lead to flooding. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Portland, Dunkirk, Redkey, Pennville, Center, Salamonia, College Corner, Collett, Blaine, Liber, New Mount Pleasant, Como, Bluff Point, Boundary City, Brice and Bellfountain. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EDT THIS EVENING
